leukapp.apps.workflows.factories module¶

Testing factories for the workflows. This module relies heavily on the factory_boy python package.

class WorkflowFactory[source]¶

Bases: factory.django.DjangoModelFactory

Creates an Workflow instance.

Mainly used for testing purposes. If no keyword arguments are provided, this class will generate the appropriate field values using the rules described in the attributes. For more information see: DjangoModelFactory.

Parameters:
  • extraction (Extraction) – ForeignKey to the Extraction model.
  • ext_id (str) – Sequencing Center’s ID to track the Workflow.
  • projects (list) – list of Projects to be linked.
  • projects_string (str) – String used to link projects to workflows.
  • sequencing_center (str) – Sequencing center name.
  • sequencing_technology (str) – Sequencing technology name.
  • technology_type (str) – Sequencing technology type.
  • sequencing_platform (str) – Sequencing platform used.
  • read_length (str) – Workflow’s read length.
  • read_type (str) – Workflow’s read type.
Returns:Workflow instance.

Examples:

# No arguments, attributes will be assigned randomly
workflow = WorkflowFactory()

# Passing specific values to specific attributes
workflow = WorkflowFactory(extraction=ExtractionFactory())

# passing a list of projects for ManyToMany relationship
projects = [ProjectFactory() for i in range(3)]
workflow = WorkflowFactory(analyte=DNA, projects=projects)

Warning

Everytime WorkflowFactory is used without passing the aliquot attribute, a new Extraction and its parents: Aliquot, Specimen and Individual) will be created.

extraction = <factory.declarations.SubFactory object>¶

If not passed, creates a new Aliquot instance. To learn more see SubFactory.

ext_id = <factory.fuzzy.FuzzyText object>¶

If not passed, creates a random ID. To learn more see FuzzyText.

projects_string = ''¶

By default, this attribute is set to ''. However, pass a string with Projects primary keys separated by a | character to link the new Workflow and the projects. To understand better this behavior see: _get_projects_from_string().

sequencing_platform = <factory.fuzzy.FuzzyChoice object>¶

If not passed, picks a random choice from PLATFORM. To learn more see FuzzyChoice.

sequencing_center = <factory.fuzzy.FuzzyChoice object>¶

If not passed, picks a random choice from CENTER. To learn more see FuzzyChoice.

read_length = <factory.fuzzy.FuzzyChoice object>¶

If not passed, picks a random choice from READ_LENGTH. To learn more see FuzzyChoice.

read_type = <factory.fuzzy.FuzzyChoice object>¶

If not passed, picks a random choice from READ_TYPE. To learn more see FuzzyChoice.

sequencing_technology = <factory.declarations.LazyAttribute object>¶

If not passed, picks a random choice from INT_ID_TECHNOLOGY using the method sequencing_technology(). To learn more see the lazy_attribute decorator.

technology_type = <factory.declarations.LazyAttribute object>¶

If not passed, picks a random choice from INT_ID_TECHNOLOGY using the method technology_type(). To learn more see the lazy_attribute decorator.

projects = <factory.declarations.PostGeneration object>¶

Pass a list of projects to create ManyToMany relationships. To learn more see Factory’s documentation for simple ManyToMany relationship.
